description.en:
An introduction to the atomic, molecular and crystal spectra theory will be given, including formation of energetic states for configurations of equivalent electrons. Basic concepts of group theory (highlighting its practical applications to the qualitative description of the impurity ion states in crystals) will be introduced and illustrated by numerous examples, related to the spectroscopic properties of 3d and 4f ions in crystals. Basic processes of interaction of atoms with incident light will be considered. Special features of transition and rare earth ions with respect to their potential laser applications will be addressed. A few commonly used crystal field models will be described, along with examples of their applications. 
Basic knowledge of quantum mechanics and solid state physics is desirable. The lectures will be given in English. Consultations after lectures will be available (in Russian, if needed).
description.et:
Antakse sissejuhatav ülevaade aatomite, molekulide ja kristallide spektraalkarakteristikast. Antakse algteadmised rühmateooriast koos rakendusnäidetega, mis on seotud valdavalt 3d ja 4f lisandi-ioonide spektroskoopiliste omadustega kristallides. Vaadeldakse põhilisi aatomi ja kiirguse vahelisi interaktsioone. Pööratakse tähelepanu siirdemetallide ja harilike muldmetallide spetsiifilistele optilistele omadustele seoses nende rakendamisega laserites. Kirjeldatakse levinumaid kristallivälja mudeleid koos rakendusnäidetega.
Kursusel osalemiseks oleksid soovitavad põhiteadmised kvantmehhaanikast ja tahke keha füüsikast. Loengud toimuvad inglise keeles, peale loengut on võimalik saada täiendavat konsultatsiooni (vajadusel vene keeles).

objectives.en: The course is aimed to provide students with the basic knowledge of the spectroscopy of impurity ions in crystals. It can be of interest for students specializing in laser spectroscopy, materials science, quantum chemistry or solid state physics.
objectives.et: Kursuse eemärgiks on anda põhiteadmised lisandiga aktiveeritud kristallide spektroskoopiast. Kursus pakub huvi üliõpilastele, kes on spetsialiseerunud laserspektroskoopiale, materjaliteadusele, kvantkeemiale või tahkisefüüsikale.

learning_outcomes.en: After finishing this course, the student is supposed to:
learning_outcomes.et: Peale kursuse läbimist peaks üliõpilane valdama järgmiseid teadmisi.

learning_outcomes.en: 1. Understand the origin of energetic states, absorption and luminescence spectra of impurity ions in crystals in solids;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. Kristalli lisanditsentrite energeetiliste seisundite, neeldumis- ja luminestsentsispektrite päritolu;

learning_outcomes.en: 2. Be familiar with the basic features and properties of 3d- and 4f-ions doped crystals for solid state lasers;
learning_outcomes.et: 2. 3d- ja 4f-ioonidega aktiveeritud kristallide optilised omadused ja nende rakendamine tahkislaserites;

learning_outcomes.en: 3. Know the basic ideas of the group theory and its applications in atomic spectra theory, crystal field theory and use them in solving spectroscopic problems (selection rules, energy level splitting due to the symmetry lowering).
learning_outcomes.et: 3. Algteadmised rühmateooriast ja selle lihtsamad rakendused aatomite ja kristalli lisanditsentrite spektroskoopiliste omaduste analüüsimisel (valikureeglid, energiatasemete lõhenemine sümmeetria alandamisel jms).

description.et: Lecture 1 - Introduction
Lecture 2 - Emission and absorption of light; a shape of the emission band
Lecture 3 - Absorption of light in a two-level system
Lecture 4 - Absorption of light: dispersion, saturation, oscillator strengths, population inversion
Lecture 5 - Theory of atom of hydrogen

Lecture 6 - Wave functions of the hydrogen atom; calculations of the mean values;
selection rules for the electric dipole transitions
Lecture 7 - Fine structure of the energy levels; multielectron atoms
Lecture 8 - Multielectron atoms: parity of states, addition of angular momenta, electronic configurations and electrostatic terms
Lecture 9 - Multielectron atoms: configurations of equivalent electrons
Lecture 10 - Multielectron atoms: electron shells filling, fine structure of the energy levels, 3d and 4f ions
Lecture 11 - A molecule of hydrogen H2; Adiabatic approximation
Lecture 12 - Rotational and vibrational transitions in diatomic molecules

Lecture 13 - Rotational spectra of symmetric rotors, rotational Raman spectroscopy and 
some remarks on the second quantization
Lecture 14 - Vibrations of polyatomic molecules
Lecture 15 - Electron-vibrational interaction and its manifestation in optical spectra
Lecture 16 - Basic foundations of group theory
Lecture 17 - Representations of the point groups
Lecture 18 - Classification of the point groups; Continuous and double groups
Lecture 19 - Group theory and analysis of the energy levels splitting and selection rules
Lecture 20 - Group theory and analysis of the energy levels splitting and selection rules - continued
Lecture 21 - Crystal field theory and calculations of the energy levels of ions in crystals
Lecture 22 - Crystal field theory: weak, medium and strong crystal fields; energy levels of d-electrons in crystal fields
Lecture 23 - Spectra of transition metal ions in crystals
Lecture 24 - Spectra of rare earth ions in crystals
Lecture 25 - Non-radiative transitions in impurity centers. Jahn-Teller effect
Lecture 26 - Modeling of optical properties of 3d and 4f ions in crystals
Lecture 27 - Relations between energy levels and Hamiltonian parameters for free ions
Lecture 28 - Examples of ab initio calculations of physical properties of pure crystals
Lecture 29 - Examples of ab initio calculations of physical properties of doped crystals
Lecture 30 - Review lecture of the topics covered in the first half of the course
Lecture 31 - Review lecture of the topics covered in the second half of the course
Lecture 32 - Free discussion; preparation for the oral exam
